alert.note: Alert for Lower Treasure Valley; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Ada, southwestern Elmore and west central Owyhee Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 445 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Grand View, or 16 miles west of Mountain Home, moving northwest at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cinder Cone Butte around 450 PM MDT. Swan Falls, Murphy and Big Foot Butte around 510 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Lower Treasure Valley; Upper Treasure Valley
